title: [$250] Reports Submit With $0.00 Total and Expenses Disappear After Submission in New Expensify

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Needs Reproduction
labels.description: Reproducible steps needed

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Leeckhart **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770651897151899) ## Action Performed: 1. Create one or more expenses (e.g., Spotify charge for $19.99) 2. Add the expense(s) to a report 3. Manually submit the report (not auto-submit) 4. Admin or approver reviews the report and may change the approver or approval path 5. Observe the report state after submission or approval ## Expected Result: Submitted reports retain all included expenses. Report totals remain accurate and non-zero unless explicitly empty. Approved reports remain approved and do not revert to earlier workflow states. ## Actual Result: Reports appear with a $0.00 total and no visible expenses. Previously added expenses disappear after submission or approval. Some reports skip the export step. Report status may revert to “Waiting for approval” or “Outstanding” after approval. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770651897151899) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Company card transactions not auto-merging after migration to New Expensify (duplicate expenses created)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction Blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @Leeckhart
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770646896767269)

## Action Performed:

1. Migrated customer’s company cards to New Expensify
2. Card transactions began importing
3. User had expenses/receipts already created (or created expenses around the same time)
4. Transactions that should have auto-merged did not merge, resulting in duplicate line items

## Expected Result:
Card transactions should automatically merge with the matching expense (same amount/date/merchant) so there is one expense record with the card transaction + receipt info, preventing duplicates and keeping the accounting record accurate.
## Actual Result:
Auto-merge fails for some card transactions after migration. The system shows two separate expenses with the same date and amount (and same/related merchant)
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshots for the issue are in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770646896767269)

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)


<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @brunovjk</details>

**Version Number:** 9.3.7-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @abbagail 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770334985877179)

## Action Performed:

1. Open an expense
2. Edit the Tag field
3. Save the tag
4. Submit the expense report
5. Review the expense for violations

## Expected Result:
The selected tag should remain valid after saving and submitting.
No violation should be triggered.
## Actual Result:
A violation is shown:
ND: “Departments are no longer valid”
Classic: “Tag no longer valid”, extra : at the start of the invalid tag.

## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome

- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$250] An “Approves To” approver is not getting the first notification email when a Report is approved and forwarded to them

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.13 - 0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @jliexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [expensify_bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770369717334829) ## Action Performed: Precondition: User experiencing bug must be the Approves To approver for users. Also needs an additional Admin to take over as approver 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Submit Report to 1st Approver 3. 1st Approver approves report > forwards it to the Final Approver (i.e. the Approves To person) 4. Final Approver does not receive any notification emails re: Report being approved 5. Have another Admin take control of the report, approve it > forward to the Final Approver again 6. Final Approver receives a notification email ## Expected Result: Final Approver should receive an email anytime a Report is forwarded to them for approval. ## Actual Result: Final Approver doesn’t receive the first notification email, but receives subsequent emails. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/828c15fe-c628-41b4-ab2c-30e049511e41 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @jjcoffee

body:
Sentry Issue: [APP-29B](https://expensify.sentry.io/issues/7095892464/?referrer=github_integration)

```
Error: TaskQueue: Error with task : [Pusher] instance not found. Pusher.subscribe()
            most likely has been called before Pusher.init()
  at InteractionManager.runAfterInteractions$argument_0 (src/libs/Pusher/index.native.ts:214:40)
```

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>
